projecttitle: Dangoumana region Hydroagricultural Development (PAHD)
project_descrip: Short: DANGOUMANA REGION HYDROAGRICULTURAL DEVELOPMENT (PAHD) Long: The overall objective of the project is to reduce rural household poverty and food insecurity through increased agricultural production, productivity and commercialization in Dangoumana areas. Specifically, the project will (i) develop irrigated agricultural land (2,000ha) and community-managed irrigation (pumping station and irrigation system) (ii) increase agriculture production and productivity and (iii) Increase smallholder farmers' income and reduce poverty and food insecurity, and thus improve the livelihood of the rural population, (iv) create commercial opportunities in the targeted agro-entrepreneurs with the objective to generate access to markets
shortdescription: DANGOUMANA REGION HYDROAGRICULTURAL DEVELOPMENT (PAHD)
longdescription: The overall objective of the project is to reduce rural household poverty and food insecurity through increased agricultural production, productivity and commercialization in Dangoumana areas. Specifically, the project will (i) develop irrigated agricultural land (2,000ha) and community-managed irrigation (pumping station and irrigation system) (ii) increase agriculture production and productivity and (iii) Increase smallholder farmers' income and reduce poverty and food insecurity, and thus improve the livelihood of the rural population, (iv) create commercial opportunities in the targeted agro-entrepreneurs with the objective to generate access to markets

projecttitle: Production and Processing of Certified Rice Seed
project_descrip: Short: PRODUCTION AND PROCESSING OF CERTIFIED RICE SEED Long: The aim of the project is to contribute towards enhancement of food security by increasingproduction and productivity of rice, the key staple crop in Cote dâ€™Ivoire. This will be achieved by increasing the national production capacity for certified rice seeds. When fullyimplemented, rice productivity will, on average, increase by 30% from its present level in allecosystems with active involvement of the farmers who will have access to selected qualityseeds. More specifically (i) production of certified commercial rice seeds--R1 will increase by 12,600 MT by 2018, representing 20% of the national projected 2018 needs-- 63,000 MT, and (ii) rain fed rice yields will increase from 0.8 to 1.9 MT/ha, (iii) flooded rice yields will increase from 2.5 to 5MT/ha per cycle, ( iv) irrigated rice will increase from 3.5 to 10MT/ha/year, and (v) average farmerâ€™s income is expected to increase by 60% by project end.
shortdescription: PRODUCTION AND PROCESSING OF CERTIFIED RICE SEED
longdescription: The aim of the project is to contribute towards enhancement of food security by increasingproduction and productivity of rice, the key staple crop in Cote dâ€™Ivoire. This will be achieved by increasing the national production capacity for certified rice seeds. When fullyimplemented, rice productivity will, on average, increase by 30% from its present level in allecosystems with active involvement of the farmers who will have access to selected qualityseeds. More specifically (i) production of certified commercial rice seeds--R1 will increase by 12,600 MT by 2018, representing 20% of the national projected 2018 needs-- 63,000 MT, and (ii) rain fed rice yields will increase from 0.8 to 1.9 MT/ha, (iii) flooded rice yields will increase from 2.5 to 5MT/ha per cycle, ( iv) irrigated rice will increase from 3.5 to 10MT/ha/year, and (v) average farmerâ€™s income is expected to increase by 60% by project end.

projecttitle: Mohmand Dam and Hydropower Project (MDHP) - Pakistan
project_descrip: Short: MOHMAND DAM AND HYDROPOWER PROJECT (MDHP) - PAKISTAN Long: While Pakistan is blessed with water resources, they constitute both an untapped resource and a threat when natural disasters occur. In addition, KP Province is a post-conflict area that is close to the border of Afghanistan and where socio-economic development is a priority to reduce marginalization and inequity among the local population, which is also a means of mitigating extremism.The Project aims to contribute to national energy security, as well as contributing to the regional socio-economic development of KP Province. The Project Development Objective (PDO) is to enhance energy generation and provide sustainable water resources for agriculture and human consumption in KP, while improving the region resilience to floods.In 2018, the World Economic Forum (WEF) Global Competitiveness Report ranked Pakistan 115th among 137 economies in the reliability of electricity supply. Achieving energy security through development of the country's indigenous hydropower resources continues to be the highest priority for the GOP. In addition, water storage is becoming an increasing concern for the Country as most of the Agricultural output in Pakistan is dependent on artificial canal irrigation. Consequently, the proposed Mohmand Dam and Hydropower Project is a key priority for the Country for immediate development un
shortdescription: MOHMAND DAM AND HYDROPOWER PROJECT (MDHP) - PAKISTAN
longdescription: While Pakistan is blessed with water resources, they constitute both an untapped resource and a threat when natural disasters occur. In addition, KP Province is a post-conflict area that is close to the border of Afghanistan and where socio-economic development is a priority to reduce marginalization and inequity among the local population, which is also a means of mitigating extremism.The Project aims to contribute to national energy security, as well as contributing to the regional socio-economic development of KP Province. The Project Development Objective (PDO) is to enhance energy generation and provide sustainable water resources for agriculture and human consumption in KP, while improving the region resilience to floods.In 2018, the World Economic Forum (WEF) Global Competitiveness Report ranked Pakistan 115th among 137 economies in the reliability of electricity supply. Achieving energy security through development of the country's indigenous hydropower resources continues to be the highest priority for the GOP. In addition, water storage is becoming an increasing concern for the Country as most of the Agricultural output in Pakistan is dependent on artificial canal irrigation. Consequently, the proposed Mohmand Dam and Hydropower Project is a key priority for the Country for immediate development un

projecttitle: Enhancing Agricultural Production using Efficient Irrigation System in Balochistan
project_descrip: Short: ENHANCING AGRICULTURAL PRODUCTION USING EFFICIENT IRRIGATION SYSTEM IN BALOCHISTAN Long: The development objective of the TA is to improve farm productivity through piloting innovative, resource efficient water and farm management techniques in Zhob and Nasirabad Divisions of Balochistan. The specific objectives of the project are: (i) farm productivity and profitability in the targeted locations enhanced, (ii) awareness and buy-in for resource efficient, climate smart, irrigation technologies developed among farmers, and (iii) increased uptake of irrigation technologies by farmers in Zhob and Nasirabad.
shortdescription: ENHANCING AGRICULTURAL PRODUCTION USING EFFICIENT IRRIGATION SYSTEM IN BALOCHISTAN
longdescription: The development objective of the TA is to improve farm productivity through piloting innovative, resource efficient water and farm management techniques in Zhob and Nasirabad Divisions of Balochistan. The specific objectives of the project are: (i) farm productivity and profitability in the targeted locations enhanced, (ii) awareness and buy-in for resource efficient, climate smart, irrigation technologies developed among farmers, and (iii) increased uptake of irrigation technologies by farmers in Zhob and Nasirabad.

project_descrip: Short: IMPROVEMENT OF WATER RESOURCES MANAGEMENT IN KHATLON REGION PROJECT Long: The Project development objective is to improve the livelihood of the rural population, through improvement of water resources management with resilience to climate change impacts. The project will result in increase of agriculture production by 110,000 tons per year, 2,000 new permanent, and 15,000 seasonal job opportunity will be created. 60,000 rural people will be provided with access to improved water supply.
shortdescription: IMPROVEMENT OF WATER RESOURCES MANAGEMENT IN KHATLON REGION PROJECT
longdescription: The Project development objective is to improve the livelihood of the rural population, through improvement of water resources management with resilience to climate change impacts. The project will result in increase of agriculture production by 110,000 tons per year, 2,000 new permanent, and 15,000 seasonal job opportunity will be created. 60,000 rural people will be provided with access to improved water supply.

projecttitle: Training of Trainers on Basic Irrigation Applications for Selected Sub-sahran Countries
project_descrip: Short: TRAINING OF TRAINERS ON BASIC IRRIGATION APPLICATIONS FOR SELECTED SUB-SAHRAN COUNTRIES Long: The objectives of this training are to familiarize the participating experts with the topics related to irrigation including the soil-plant-water relations and calculations about hydraulic, land preparation for irrigation, drainage, salinity and water quality. Under this training program, it is aimed to enhance the capacity of participants to act as trainers in their respective countries.
shortdescription: TRAINING OF TRAINERS ON BASIC IRRIGATION APPLICATIONS FOR SELECTED SUB-SAHRAN COUNTRIES
longdescription: The objectives of this training are to familiarize the participating experts with the topics related to irrigation including the soil-plant-water relations and calculations about hydraulic, land preparation for irrigation, drainage, salinity and water quality. Under this training program, it is aimed to enhance the capacity of participants to act as trainers in their respective countries.

projecttitle: Self-repairing advanced coating BUYAN , for water reservoirs, channels and pipelines aiming to prevent water waste, leakage and supply efficient irrig
project_descrip: Short: SELF-REPAIRING ADVANCED COATING BUYAN , FOR WATER RESERVOIRS, CHANNELS AND PIPELINES AIMING TO PREVENT WATER WASTE, LEAKAGE AND SUPPLY EFFICIENT IRRIG Long: Proposal Objective(s): The main aim of the present proposal is to develop a self-repairing advanced coating that both protects pipelines and other equipment that are used for water transportation or preservation from corrosion and that automatically repairs the damages on the subject equipment. The project also includes the set up of a serial production facility and a portable application system.
shortdescription: SELF-REPAIRING ADVANCED COATING BUYAN , FOR WATER RESERVOIRS, CHANNELS AND PIPELINES AIMING TO PREVENT WATER WASTE, LEAKAGE AND SUPPLY EFFICIENT IRRIG
longdescription: Proposal Objective(s): The main aim of the present proposal is to develop a self-repairing advanced coating that both protects pipelines and other equipment that are used for water transportation or preservation from corrosion and that automatically repairs the damages on the subject equipment. The project also includes the set up of a serial production facility and a portable application system.

projecttitle: Training of Trainers on Advanced Irrigation Techniques for Selected IsDB Member Countries- Phase III
project_descrip: Short: TRAINING OF TRAINERS ON ADVANCED IRRIGATION TECHNIQUES FOR SELECTED ISDB MEMBER COUNTRIES- PHASE III Long: The objective of the training is to enhance the capacity of the participants specialized in agricultural mechanization, maintenance and adjustment of agricultural machinery and equipment that would improve the agricultural production capacity of the selected African IsDB MCs.

projecttitle: Irrigation Schemes Development in Unyama, Namalu and Sipi Regions Uganda
project_descrip: Short: IRRIGATION SCHEMES DEVELOPMENT IN UNYAMA, NAMALU AND SIPI REGIONS UGANDA Long: The overall goal of the Project is to contribute to poverty reduction and economic growth in Uganda through enhanced productivity and commercialization of agriculture. The development objective is to improve household incomes, food security, and climate resilience through sustainable natural resources management and agricultural enterprise development. The Project interventions, including irrigation schemes will be implemented in Unyama, Namalu and Sipi regions covering approximately 4,100 ha.
